Different sections report on temperatures and methods applicable for the synthesis and examination of polymer electrolytes with altered sequences, leading to significant improvements in lithium-ion conductivity and transference numbers by structuring monomers and creating specific sequences. This approach enables high-performance all-solid-state lithium batteries at lower operational temperatures by optimizing ion dissociation and mobility.
